automationNetwork

Interface Network

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ValerieNetwork

    public interface Network
    Defines how to communicate with the attached network. Default implementation is ValerieNetwork. This allows communication with an ArduIMU-based network of peripherals running Valerie's custom network layer. this is because the communication messages may be application-sensitive (i.e. using a ZibBee-based network layer may require different message types).
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Paul White

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addListener(NetworkListener newListener)
      Add a delegate to listen to network events.
      boolean removePeripheral(int peripheralID)
      Instruct the network to stop communicating with the peripheral having ID peripheralID.

      Instruct the network to start listening for new peripherals.

    • Method Detail

      • startListening

        boolean startListening()
        Instruct the network to start listening for new peripherals.
        Returns:
        true if successfully started listening, false otherwise.

      • stopListening

        boolean stopListening()
        Instruct the network to stop listening for new peripherals.
        Returns:
        true if successfully stopped listening, false otherwise.

      • removePeripheral

        boolean removePeripheral(int peripheralID)
        Instruct the network to stop communicating with the peripheral having ID peripheralID.
        Parameters:
        peripheralID - the peripheral to delete
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise.

      • addListener

        void addListener(NetworkListener newListener)
        Add a delegate to listen to network events. Be careful, consult your implementation to ensure that it supports more than one listener.
        Parameters:
        newListener - the new delegate

      • sendPacket

        boolean sendPacket(int peripheralID,
                 java.lang.Object data)
        Send a packet to a particular peripheral in the network.
        Parameters:
        peripheralID - the ID of the peripheral to send the message to
        data - the data to send
        Returns:
        true if successfully sent, false if not. Also return false if there is no peripheral with ID peripheralID.
